Prediction can be really, really hard. Chaos theory really throws a wrench into nearly all predictive model systems of natural phenomena just due to the highly interconnected nature of natural systems, one model just won’t do it.

keeping tabs on The Next One

Earthquake prediction and early warning systems have been improving dramatically over the years especially on the few hours before a major quake event, mainly due to a significant improvement in computational power, but also a significant improvement in narrowing down key variables.

def print_hi(name)
  puts "Hi, #{name}"
end
print_hi('Tom')
#=> prints 'Hi, Tom' to STDOUT.
